parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Identity </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets rank of given unit.

Possible values: PRIVATE, CORPORAL, SERGEANT, LIEUTENANT, CAPTAIN, MAJOR or COLONEL. <br><br>

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature arma3</title><part><name index="1"/><value> Since Arma 3 v1.67 this command is <template><title>EffArg</title><part><name index="1"/><value>cmd</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>arg</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>loc</value></part></template> <template><title>EffArg</title><part><name index="1"/><value>cmd</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>eff</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>glob</value></part></template></value></part></template></value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unitName '''setRank''' rank </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> rank: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] '''setRank''' "COLONEL"</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[rank]], [[setUnitRank]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on Mar 26, 2009 - 19:24
<dt class="note">[[User:Wolfrug|Wolfrug]]<dd class="note">
Changing a unit's rank using either [[setUnitRank]] or [[setRank]] will also REPLACE their current rating dependent on their new rank (colonels have a rating of 7500 etc). That is to say REPLACE, not add to: the unit's old rating will disappear with the rank change.
<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 12, 2014
<dt class="note">[[User:Waffle SS.|Waffle SS.]]
<dd class="note">Behavior when used on players in multiplayer seems unpredictable. (Arma 3 1.00)
<BR><BR>
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
